news_header: Finnish companies' outlook on the economic situation has improved, indicating a recovery.
news_text: A recent survey by the chambers of commerce shows that Finnish companies have a more positive view of the economic situation. According to Jukka Appelqvist, the chief economist of the Central Chamber of Commerce, the survey supports the interpretation that a recovery from the economic downturn has begun. 35% of responding companies reported an increase in revenue compared to the previous year, up from 29% in May. Expectations for future order volumes are also more optimistic. The survey, conducted at the end of September, included nearly 1,500 companies from various parts of Finland.
